Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Womankind \Wom"an*kind`\, n. The females of the human race; women, collectively. [1913 Webster]
A sanctuary into which womankind, with her tools of magic, the broom and mop, has very infrequent access. --Hawthorne. [1913 Webster]
womankind n : women as distinguished from men
